text: Random question of the day for developers - When does a CMS bring you value?  When does it bring your client/marketing team value?  If you have thoughts on this, I would love to hear them.

<@U014A8JD9DH> fair.  Would you say that convenience for a marketer would be something like finding a template that fits their layout needs in their theme?

What would you consider the most convenient thing about a platform that you're building on?

The most convenient thing for marketers may be to do technically complex things without having to bother doing actually technically complex things aka. calling the IT in worst case. The huge abstraction on top of technically managing content and presentation is the one and only advantage of a cms.

i think it is about being able to do things the way the marketer wants it too without having technical knowledge. When i first showed Themes to Non-technical marketers who are well versed in HubSpot, the ability to change the order of sections  and columns widths was really valuable for them and scratched an itch. I would not  call it convenience, in my view it is more about flexibility.

And that flexibility als translates to  Speed which is super important for marketers in this fast paced world today. Being able to crank out a lot of pages with Variations for A/B Testing is super valuable in my opinion.
For us the CMS brings value if it lets us  easily empower those who need the features quickly, for me this refers to efficiency a lot.
